result.execSummary:
The defendant was charged with both OWI (6th) and Operating w/ PAC (6th). The defendant was found guilty of OWI (6th) and the other charge, Operating w/ PAC (6th) was dismissed by the court.

  • Daniel W Taliaferro was found guilty of OWI (6th), a class H felony, Wisconsin Statutes 346.63(1)(a).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes: IID restriction effective upon licensure for 36 mo.

miscConds.notes: $2327  to be paid by the defendant to the Clerk of Courts office within 60 days.

DA has 90 days to prepare/submit order. Bond to apply. To be collected by the Department of Corrections.  Court financial obligations shall be paid at the rate of 25% of the prison wages and work release funds.  Restitution shall be paid pursuant to separate court order.

Maintain absolute sobriety.  Do not drive a motor vehicle without valid DL and approval of agent. Def shall not be at any bars, taverns, liquor stores or any establishment whose primary purpose is the sale of alcohol.
Sobrietor for 12 mo.  Defendant shall complete a risk and needs assessment and comply with care plan goals related to prioritized need areas identified.

timeConds.notes: WIth huber. Credit DOES apply.  Provisions of 973.09(1)(d) (Good Time) apply.

Final pre-trial at 12-02-2015 02:45 pm
Court entered not guilty plea for defendant.  Motions due in 20 days.  Bail continued.
Copy given defendant, reading waived.
Trial Judge - Br 2

Defendant Daniel W Taliaferro in court. Prosecuting Atty Shaun W O'Connell appeared for State of Wisconsin. Defendant doesn't qualify for an attorney thru the Dane County Criminal Defense Project. Court reviewed the papers regarding the appointment of counsel. Court affirmed the denial of a court appointed attorney. Court explained to the defendant what a preliminary hearing is. ADA O'Connell is satisfied with the steps that have been taken to get the defendant an attorney and he wishes to proceed with the preliminary hearing. Court proceeded with the PH. MAPD Justin Nelson sworn by the court and testified. Direct exam by ADA O'Connell. Witness identified defendant. No cross exam. Witness excused. No further witnesses. State moves for bindover, waives argument, reserves rebuttal. Court finds defendant committed a felony and ordered him boundover for further proceedings.
Defendant not eligible for court appointed counsel through Dane County - income over established guideline.
Preliminary hearing at 09-11-2015 01:30 pm
Reporter: Teri Groves; defn requests 6 weeks to retain counsel. ADA requests 3 wks. CT granted 3 wk ext and set a prelim date. Will likely proceed without counsel.
Defendant appeared.  Joseph E. Mimier appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Defn wishes to obtain counsel. Defn waives statutory time limits. Status conference set and notice given in Court.
Status conference on August 24, 2015 at 02:30 pm.

Defendant stood mute.  Court entered not guilty plea as to any misdemeanor counts.  Preliminary hearing scheduled for August 4, 2015 at 01:15 pm.
